description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made the vow Tuesday amid the negotiations mediated by Egypt that seek to reach a cease-fire deal that could see the release of some or all of the remaining hostages.
title: Israel will invade Gaza's Rafah 'with or without' a hostage deal, Netanyahu says

description: A federal court has blocked Louisiana's new congressional map in a case that could determine the balance of power in the next Congress and set up another Supreme Court test of the Voting Rights Act.
title: Judges block Louisiana's congressional map. A Supreme Court appeal is likely

description:
Dame Judi Dench has played everyone from the writer Iris Murdoch to M in the James Bond films. But among the roles the actress is most closely associated, are Shakespeare's heroines and some of his villians.

Amongst those roles are the star-crossed lover Juliet, the comical Titania and the tragic Lady Macbeth. Now she's reflecting on that work, and Shakespeare's work in Shakespeare: The Man Who Pays The Rent.

The book is comprised of Dench's conversations with her friend, the actor and director Brendan O'Hea.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: Judi Dench reflects on a career built around Shakespeare

description: Aviva Siegel, 63, was taken hostage by Hamas militants on Oct. 7, along with her husband Keith. She was released after 51 days, but he was not. On Saturday, Hamas released a video showing Keith alive.
title: A freed Israeli hostage waits with hope for her husband, still held by Hamas in Gaza

description: A United Nations official said negotiators have a "clear path to landing an ambitious deal" on plastic pollution. But environmentalists say the plastic industry is undermining an effective agreement.
title: With a deadline looming, countries race for a global agreement to cut plastic waste

description: Campus protesters want administrators to sell off investments in companies with ties to Israel. Here's a look at what divestment means — and why universities are saying no.
title: University protesters want divestments from Israel. Here's what that means

description: In a new interview with TIME Magazine, Trump promises to prosecute President Biden, unleash the National Guard on immigrants and says it's "irrelevant" if he's comfortable criminalizing abortions.
title: Saying he was too nice in his first term, Trump plots an aggressive second chance

description: The Justice Department is expected to propose a new, lower classification for marijuana that would lessen restrictions on the drug. But there's another review process to come.
title: The Biden administration is moving to reclassify marijuana. Here's what that means

description:
Israel has been public with it's plan to conduct an assault on the city of Rafah, in southern Gaza, absent a ceasefire agreement with Hamas. Such a military operation could be catastrophic for more than a million Palestinian civilians there, many having fled there from fighting elsewhere in Gaza. We hear the voices of people who are weighing the risks of staying and wondering where they can go.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: An Agonizing Choice: Whether to Flee Southern Gaza Ahead of Assault

description: The Federal Reserve is expected to hold interest rates steady this week — and possibly for months to come — as policymakers try to sort through mixed signals about the U.S. economy.
title: With mixed economic signals, the Federal Reserve is likely to stand pat on rates

description: Democrats have been telegraphing for weeks their willingness to help Mike Johnson — a Republican — keep his job as speaker if members of his own party trigger a vote to oust him.
title: House Democratic leaders say they would help save Speaker Johnson's job

description: Nicaragua brought the case arguing that by providing arms to Israel, Germany is failing to prevent possible genocide against Palestinians in Israel's war with Hamas in Gaza.
title: A top U.N. court won't order Germany to halt weapons exports to Israel

description: A rise in breast cancer among younger women prompted the U.S. Preventive Task Force to issue new screening guidelines. They recommend mammograms every other year, starting at age 40.
title: Mammograms should start at age 40, new guidelines recommend

description: Every year, the town of San Antero celebrates the hardworking pack animals that haul crops and supplies for farmers who can't afford trucks or motorcycles. There's even a donkey beauty pageant.
title: Donkeys take center stage at an annual festival in Colombia

description: Pro-Palestinian student protesters have occupied a campus building. Electric vehicles are the newest front of competition between the U.S. and China.
title: Columbia students barricade themselves in campus building; China's EV vehicles

description: A therapy that restores brain cells impaired by a rare genetic disorder may offer a strategy for treating conditions like autism, epilepsy, and schizophrenia.
title: Scientists restore brain cells impaired by a rare genetic disorder

description: As protests against the U.S. policy in Gaza unfold on college campuses across the country, the State Department is facing its own protests too.
title: A U.S. diplomat tells NPR why she resigned in protest over the policy in Gaza

description: More states than ever are gearing up to vote on abortion rights this fall, including Republican-led Missouri. There, voters could show the issue isn't a down-ballot Democratic dream everywhere.
title: Abortion rights on the ballot may not be bad news for Republicans everywhere

description: Federal judges have enormous power over their courtrooms and their chambers, which can leave employees vulnerable to abuse, with few ways to report their concerns anonymously.
title: Victims of harassment by federal judges often find the judiciary is above the law

description: Ken Wilcox's life felt hopeless, like there was nowhere left to turn. Then a simple act from a stranger on the street changed his perspective and his life.
title: A simple smile saved this man's life

description: Agreeing to an out-of-network doctor's financial policy, which protects their ability to get paid and may be littered with confusing jargon, can create a binding contract that leaves a patient owing.
title: Sign here? Financial agreements may leave doctors in the driver's seat

description: Students entered Hamilton and John Jay halls early Tuesday morning and began moving furniture and climbing through open windows. The school's public safety department is responding.
title: Protesters at Columbia University have begun occupying a campus building

description: Students began occupying Hamilton Hall early Tuesday morning. The university's public safety department urged people to avoid coming to the Morningside campus Tuesday if they could.
title: Protesters at Columbia University have begun occupying a campus building

description: Mexico is taking Ecuador to the top U.N. court Tuesday, accusing the nation of violating international law by storming the Mexican Embassy in Quito.
title: Mexico is taking Ecuador to the top U.N. court over storming of the Mexican Embassy

description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration unveiled the final version of the new regulation on Monday and called it the most significant safety rule in the past two decades.
title: U.S. to require automatic emergency braking on new vehicles in 5 years

description: French actor Gérard Depardieu will face a criminal trial in October over the alleged sexual assaults in 2021 of two women on the set of a film, prosecutors announced Monday.
title: Gérard Depardieu will be tried for alleged sexual assaults on a film set
